text: __NOTOC__ Gislhere (died c. 785) was an English Bishop of Selsey in the eighth century. In 780 Gislhere witnessed a charter of Ealdorman Oslac of Sussex.Anglo-Saxons.net Charters S1184 accessed on 25 August 2007 Gislhere was present at the Synod of Brentford, Middlesex, in 781.Anglo-Saxons.net Charters S1257 accessed on 25 August 2007 Gislhere was consecrated between 772 and 780, and died between 781 and 787.Fryde, et al. Handbook of British Chronology p. 221 ==Citations== ==References== * ==External links== * Category:Bishops of Selsey Category:8th-century bishops
title: Gislhere
